Text: Would that `return null` ever get called? Either the `br.lines...` returns or an exception is thrown.

@Khaled A Khunaifer: yes, pretty sure... maybe you should have a look here: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/exceptions/tryResourceClose.html.
What you wrongly edited is a "try-with-resources" statement.
Why do you call `parallel()` on the stream?
This would not result in an _honest_ copy of the data if the source stream used windows line endings as all `\r\n` would end up getting converted into `\n`...
You can use `System.lineSeparator()` to use the appropriate platform-dependent line-ending.
